description: From Late Latin plagalis, from plaga, from plagius, from Byzantine Ancient Greek πλάγιος (plágios, “plagal”), πλάγιος (plágios, “oblique”).

adjectives.description: plagal (comparative more plagal, superlative most plagal)

entries.meaning: (music) Designating a mode lying a perfect fourth below the authentic form.
(music) Designating a cadence in which the subdominant chord precedes the tonic.
